lead_paragraph: The soon-to-be-No. 1 Jelena Jankovic beat Venus Williams to reach the Porsche Grand Prix final in Stuttgart, Germany, overcoming a painful foot injury for a 6-7 (8), 7-5, 6-2 victory. Jankovic will be going for her second title in two weeks when she plays Nadia Petrova on Sunday. Jankovic won the China Open last week and will be No. 1 when the new WTA rankings come out Monday. Petrova defeated Victoria Azarenka of Belarus, 6-4, 6-4. Jankovic has a broken toenail on her left foot and received two painkilling shots to be able to play.
